description: From Middle English incantacioun, from Old French incantation, from Latin incantatio. More at enchant.

entries.meaning: The act or process of using formulas and/or usually rhyming words, sung or spoken, with occult ceremonies, for the purpose of raising spirits, producing enchantment, or creating other magical results.
A formula of words used as above.
(computing, slang) Any esoteric command or procedure.
examples: The appropriate incantation of route is shown below; the gw keyword tells it that the next argument denotes a gateway.
